issue.title: GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint not working as expected and not retrieving profile claims
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende IdentityServer are you using?**
6.2.0
**Which version of .NET are you using?**
net7.0
**Describe the bug**
I'm following step by step quickstart.

I have the identity server configured with in memory identity resources for `OpenId` and `Profile`

profile claims not being produced despite adding
```
options.GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint = true; 
```
on oidc client, and asking for `openid` and `profile` scopes which are allowed at identity server's client configuration along with `AlwaysIncludeUserClaimsInIdToken`
```
{
    "Enabled": true,
    "ClientId": "client-web-sample",
    "ClientName": "Client Web Sample",
    "ClientSecrets": [
        {
            "Value": "whatever_encoded_secret"
        }
    ],
    "AllowedGrantTypes": [ "authorization_code" ],
    "RedirectUris": [ "http://localhost:6002/signin-oidc" ],
    "PostLogoutRedirectUris": [ "http://localhost:6002/signout-callback-oidc" ],
    "AllowedScopes": [ "openid", "profile", "my-api"],
    "AlwaysIncludeUserClaimsInIdToken": true
}
```

**To Reproduce**
[Following the documentation](https://docs.duendesoftware.com/identityserver/v6/quickstarts/2_interactive/#getting-claims-from-the-userinfo-endpoint)
I add 
```
options.GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint = true;
```
at the oidc client, which looks like this
```
JwtSecurityTokenHandler.DefaultMapInboundClaims = false;

builder
    .Services
    .AddAuthentication(options =>
    {
        options.DefaultScheme = "Cookies";
        options.DefaultChallengeScheme = "oidc";
    })
    .AddCookie("Cookies")
    .AddOpenIdConnect("oidc", options =>
    {
        options.Authority = "http://localhost:5000";
        options.RequireHttpsMetadata = false;

        options.ClientId = "client-web-sample";
        options.ClientSecret = "secret";
        options.ResponseType = "code";

        options.Scope.Clear();
        options.Scope.Add("openid");
        options.Scope.Add("profile");
        options.GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint = true; // isn't this to retrieve additional profile claims?

        options.SaveTokens = true;
    });
```

**Expected behavior**
I would expect, as documentation shows, to retrieve bob or alice's profile claims such as family_name, website, etc.
But no trace of these claims

issue.title: Missing ES384 and ES512 algorithms in the default policy
issue.body:
In this file
https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient/blob/acf47d22e4a8cd8b1ceeb4ae4dabec9e3b491cfb/src/OidcClient/Policy.cs#L70-L71

PS384 and PS512 are added twice, but ES384 and ES512 are missing

comment.body: Thanks! Could you propose a PR?

issue.title: Using CryptoHelper as general-purpose helper for non-OIDC OAuth2 clients
issue.body:
I would like to implement some OAuth2 flows with PKCE where the server does not have OIDC available (Spotify and Philips Hue).

The [`CryptoHelper` class](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient/blob/e786a8715fbc853c0dfa88ded2404f1b1ebc1190/src/OidcClient/CryptoHelper.cs#L17) would be really helpful there, but it prevents people from using it outside the OidcClient - even though I think it should not have dependencies.

It is marked `internal` and has a dependency on `OidcClientOptions` but it seems that those `OidcClientOptions` do not really have a function in the class.

Would it make sense to make this class `public` and move it to the generic [`IdentityModel`](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel) package? Or is there a better way to implement the OAuth2 flows for Spotify/Philips Hue?

Using OidcClient in general seems to have a dependency on the server implementing the `.well-known/openid-configuration` endpoint etc, which these APIs do not have.

comment.body: IdentityModel tries to have minimal dependencies and provides the primitives to build higher level libraries.

issue.title: `Invalid access token hash` error when validating at_hash with *384 and *512 signing algorithms
issue.body:
I get an `Invalid access token hash`. when trying to verify an identity token containing the `at_hash` claim and one of the following signature algorithms is used: RS384, RS512 ...

I tend to think that the `CryptoHelper.ValidateHash` method calculates an incorrect hash value for algorithm if the algorithm key length is not 256.
And the reason is in these two lines:

https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient/blob/acf47d22e4a8cd8b1ceeb4ae4dabec9e3b491cfb/src/OidcClient/CryptoHelper.cs#L61-L62

The size variable already contains the length of the needed part of the calculated hash, there is no need in the additional calculations in this lines.

comment.body:
Thanks for reporting.

Feel free to propose a fix PR - ideally with tests that exercise the various sizes.

issue.title: Add Prometheus IHttpClientFactory metrics to RemoteApis with simple HTTP forwarder
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende BFF are you using?**

2.0.0-preview.5

**Which version of .NET are you using?**

.NET Core 6.0

**Describe the question**

We use the [prometheus-net](https://github.com/prometheus-net/prometheus-net) project to instrument applications using Duende BFF. The Prometheus project includes a convenient extension method [UseHttpMetrics](https://github.com/prometheus-net/prometheus-net#ihttpclientfactory-metrics) on IHttpClientBuilder to instrument service-to-service calls. We are investigating ways to get similar behavior from Remote APIs using the built-in simple HTTP forwarder.

The Prometheus extension uses IHttpClientBuilder's ability to create a pipeline of HttpMessageHandler. Much of the implementation of both the ASP.NET Core and Prometheus extension is sealed or internal, so we can't reuse their code directly. We are considering writing our own pipeline of HttpMessageHandler and then subclassing DefaultHttpMessageInvokerFactory to return the pipeline in CreateHandler.

Are you aware of an easier solution than the one proposed above? Since Duende.Bff.Yarp uses HttpMessageInvoker instead of HttpClient, we are assuming the answer is no.

Do you have any concerns with this approach from either a correctness standpoint or compatibility with future versions of Duende.Bff and Duende.Bff.Yarp?

issue.title: Your license for Duende IdentityServer only permits 1 number of issuers. You have processed requests for 2.
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende IdentityServer are you using?**
5.2.0
**Which version of .NET are you using?**
netcoreapp3.1
**Describe the bug**

We recently migrated our identity sever from V 3.1.4 to licensed Duende IdentityServer V 5.2.0.  We are using load balancer for our IdentityServer website, when user try to access our website the DNS will hit the load balancer( we have total 3 servers on LB) and the LB will call individual sever with IP address.

**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior.

**Expected behavior**

A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Log output/exception with stacktrace**

Your license for Duende IdentityServer only permits 1 number of issuers. You have processed requests for 2. The issuers used were: 

**Additional context**

Add any other context about the problem here.

comment.body:
Typically you would use the forwarded headers middleware in ASP.NET Core to capture the host information coming from the load balancer.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/host-and-deploy/proxy-load-balancer?view=aspnetcore-7.0

If this is not possible for some reason, you can also set a static issuer name in the IdentityServer configuration

https://docs.duendesoftware.com/identityserver/v6/reference/options/#main

issue.title: scope claims not updated on refresh token request with requested scopes
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende IdentityServer are you using?**
6.2.0

**Which version of .NET are you using?**
7.0

**Describe the bug**
My client configuration is:
```cs
new Client
{
    ClientId = "mauiblazorsample",
    RequirePkce = true,
    RequireClientSecret = false,

    AllowedGrantTypes = GrantTypes.Code,

    RedirectUris = { "mauiblazorsample://authentication/login-callback" },
    PostLogoutRedirectUris = { "mauiblazorsample://authentication/logout-callback" },

    AllowOfflineAccess = true,
    AllowedScopes = { "openid", "profile", "scope1" },
                
    UpdateAccessTokenClaimsOnRefresh = true,
}
```
When I send a refresh token with the scope parameter, I expect the access_token to be updated with requested scopes but the access token returned contains scopes requested during authorization:

```http
POST /connect/token HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:5001
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

grant_type=refresh_token&refresh_token=3069641D41DAAD57AFE8EEAE21A55BAEF23F47A943516C62B83299A2E89BF868-1&scope=openid+scope1&client_id=test
```

```json
{
  "iss": "https://localhost:5001",
  "nbf": 1669843921,
  "iat": 1669843921,
  "exp": 1669847521,
  "scope": [
    "openid",
    "profile",
    "offline_access"
  ],
  "amr": [
    "pwd"
  ],
  "client_id": "mauiblazorsample",
  "sub": "1",
  "auth_time": 1669833311,
  "idp": "local",
  "sid": "345FF1C50B7BFCCECE7219BD6607EB38",
  "jti": "C9519A28873356A186B2A7903EB48FEC"
}
```

**Expected behavior**

The access token should contain scopes requested in the token request. For the example above, something like:

```json
{
  "iss": "https://localhost:5001",
  "nbf": 1669843921,
  "iat": 1669843921,
  "exp": 1669847521,
  "scope": [
    "openid",
    "scope1"
  ],
  "amr": [
    "pwd"
  ],
  "client_id": "mauiblazorsample",
  "sub": "1",
  "auth_time": 1669833311,
  "idp": "local",
  "sid": "345FF1C50B7BFCCECE7219BD6607EB38",
  "jti": "C9519A28873356A186B2A7903EB48FEC"
}

```

comment.body:
> When I send a refresh token with the scope parameter, I expect the access_token to be updated with requested scopes

This is not how it works. A refresh token can at maximum contain the scopes that were requested during the authorize request. Otherwise a client could potentially "silently" request scopes that were never consented to by the user.

The spec allows for "downscoping" - meaning a client could ask for less scopes during refresh. But we haven't implemented that.

By default a refresh token is an exact copy of the original token with an updates lifetime. `UpdateAccessTokenClaimsOnRefresh` means that we run through profile service again to update claims if needed.

issue.title: Request: add ConfigureAwaits in the Duende.AccessTokenManagement package
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende IdentityServer are you using?**
Duende.AccessTokenManagement.OpenIdConnect Version 1.0.0

**Which version of .NET are you using?**
net6.0

**Describe the bug**

Our team is using the Duende AccessTokenManagement OpenIdConnect package in our Blazor application to automatically get and refresh access tokens, using the GetAccessTokenAsync method. However, with the current version, the application hangs when trying to refresh the access tokens, in the UserTokenEndpointService.RefreshAccessTokenAsync method, where oidc.HttpClient.RequestRefreshTokenAsync is called. 

To fix the issue, we copied the implementations of IUserTokenManagementService, IUserTokenEndpointService and IUserTokenRequestSynchronization, and added ConfigureAwait(false) on every awaited Task. 

Is it possible for you to add a configurable ConfigureAwait on all awaited tasks? Similar to [this extension method from IdentityModel](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel/blob/main/src/Internal/TaskHelpers.cs)

comment.body:
To my knowledge, ASP.NET Core does not have a synchronization context. Thus ConfigureAwait is not necessary.

Do you have any documentation that states otherwise?

issue.title: Is IUserAccessTokenStore no longer injectable?
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende BFF are you using?**
v2.0.0

**Which version of .NET are you using?**
.NET 6

**Describe the bug**
Since the update to v2.0.0 of the package, It seems to be impossible to inject ```IUserAccessTokenStore``` to access the user token, it seems that starting v2.0.0 the ```.AddBff()``` extension method no longer registers the store. Are we expected to switch to injecting ```IClientCredentialsTokenManagementService``` instead? We would rather avoid it seeing how it introduces a dependency on ```Duende.Bff```

**Additional context**

Access to user token is required to setup a token delegation chain when calling remote APIs

comment.body:
Duende BFF switched to Duende.AccessTokenManagement for token management

https://github.com/DuendeSoftware/Duende.AccessTokenManagement

The class is now called `IUserTokenStore`.

issue.title: Using CryptoHelper as general-purpose helper for non-OIDC OAuth2 clients
issue.body:
I would like to implement some OAuth2 flows with PKCE where the server does not have OIDC available (Spotify and Philips Hue).

The [`CryptoHelper` class](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient/blob/e786a8715fbc853c0dfa88ded2404f1b1ebc1190/src/OidcClient/CryptoHelper.cs#L17) would be really helpful there, but it prevents people from using it outside the OidcClient - even though I think it should not have dependencies.

It is marked `internal` and has a dependency on `OidcClientOptions` but it seems that those `OidcClientOptions` do not really have a function in the class.

Would it make sense to make this class `public` and move it to the generic [`IdentityModel`](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel) package? Or is there a better way to implement the OAuth2 flows for Spotify/Philips Hue?

Using OidcClient in general seems to have a dependency on the server implementing the `.well-known/openid-configuration` endpoint etc, which these APIs do not have.

comment.body:
We currently have no plans to move this to IdentityModel. 

As I said before - feel free to copy the code for your own purposes.

issue.body:
I would like to implement some OAuth2 flows with PKCE where the server does not have OIDC available (Spotify and Philips Hue).

The [`CryptoHelper` class](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient/blob/e786a8715fbc853c0dfa88ded2404f1b1ebc1190/src/OidcClient/CryptoHelper.cs#L17) would be really helpful there, but it prevents people from using it outside the OidcClient - even though I think it should not have dependencies.

Would it make sense to make this class `public` and move it to the generic [`IdentityModel`](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel) package? Or is there a better way to implement the OAuth2 flows for Spotify/Philips Hue?

Feel free to fork the repo if you want to create derived work.

issue.title: EntityFramework.Storage project update AutoMapper to version 12 so that it works with .NET 7.
issue.body:
Hello,
I'm getting issues with IS4 running on .NET 7 It is easily resolved by updating AutoMapper to version 12 in the EntityFramework.Storage project. Can this be done please?
The error is: 
GenericArguments[0], 'System.Char', on 'T MaxFloat[T](System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1[T])' violates the constraint of type 'T'.

AutoMapper team fixed this in version 12:
https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/issues/3988

Thanks

comment.body:
> but what happens if you change the rules in the middle of the game, again!

You are raising a very good point here. With a real company and a real license/contract you can negotiate things like this just like with any other vendor you have. And we are happy to give you reasonable guarantees.

If you depend on someone's hobby project, you will not get any guarantees whatsoever.

pull_request.title: Introduce filter to allow suppression of unhandled exception logs in IdentityServer middleware
pull_request.body:
Allows customers to decide if our catch block around any IdentityServer endpoints will emit a log entry when there is an unhandled exception. The default, and primary use case is to suppress logs when the HTTP connection is cancelled early (e.g. a user navigates away or cancelled the browser request) and EF internally is detecting this and throwing the TaskCancelledException.

Fixes: https://github.com/DuendeSoftware/IdentityServer/issues/1040

pull_request.body:
Bumps [OpenTelemetry.Extensions.Hosting](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-dotnet) from 1.0.0-rc9 to 1.0.0-rc9.9.
Release notes

Sourced from OpenTelemetry.Extensions.Hosting's releases.

1.0.0-rc9.6

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.AspNetCore

  • Removed netstandard2.0 and netstandard2.1 targets. .NET 5 reached EOL in May 2022 and .NET Core 3.1 reaches EOL in December 2022. The instrumentation for ASP.NET Core now requires .NET 6 or later. (#3567)

  • Fixed an issue where activity started within middleware was modified by instrumentation library. (#3498)

  • Updated to use Activity native support from System.Diagnostics.DiagnosticSource to set activity status. (#3118) (#3555)

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.GrpcNetClient

  • Updated to use Activity native support from System.Diagnostics.DiagnosticSource to set activity status. (#3118) (#3569)

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http

  • Updated to use Activity native support from System.Diagnostics.DiagnosticSource to set activity status. (#3118) (#3555)

  • Changed activity source name from OpenTelemetry.HttpWebRequest to OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http.HttpWebRequest for HttpWebRequests and from OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http to OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http.HttpClient for HttpClient. (#3515)

1.0.0-rc9.5

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.AspNetCore

  • Fix Remote IP Address - NULL reference exception. (#3481)
  • Metrics instrumentation to correctly populate http.flavor tag. (1.1 instead of HTTP/1.1 etc.) (#3379)
  • Tracing instrumentation to populate http.flavor tag. (#3372)
  • Tracing instrumentation to populate http.scheme tag. (#3392)

pull_request.title: Bump EntityFrameworkVersion from 6.0.0 to 7.0.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps `EntityFrameworkVersion` from 6.0.0 to 7.0.0. Updates `Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite` from 6.0.0 to 7.0.0
Release notes

Sourced from Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite's releases.

EF Core 7.0 (EF7) RC2 is available from NuGet

RC2 is does not include some important fixes that will be in the GA release. Therefore, we recommend using the daily builds when testing your applications with EF7.

RC2 contains the following new features:

  • Make basic EF scenarios work under aggressive trimming
  • Entity splitting support
  • Support for GroupBy entityType
  • Support GroupJoin when it is final query operator
  • ExecuteUpdate: Add SetProperty overload that accepts a value directly (no lambda)
  • Support sproc input/output parameters on non-concurrency-token properties
  • Implement TagWith for ExecuteUpdate and DeleteUpdate
  • ExecuteDelete for owner when only its owned types are sharing the same table
  • Stop scaffolding DbSet initialization to null!
  • CSharpHelper: support more types of collection literals

RC2 also includes the following new features from previews 1 through 7 and RC1:

  • Map JSON values stored in database to EF properties
  • ExecuteUpdate/Delete (AKA bulk update, without loading data into memory)
  • Code templates for scaffolding entity types and DbContext from an existing database
  • Support raw SQL Queries for basic types like Guid, DateTime and int
  • Allow applications to create model building conventions (aka public conventions)
  • Cosmos: Support AAD RBAC via the ClientSecretCredential
  • Map inserts, updates, and deletes (CUD operations) to stored procedures
  • Add a static flag in EF that will be set when code is being executed for design-time discover
  • Support sequence key generation on SQL Server, which is useful for Table-per-concrete-type (TPC) mapping
  • Allow null connection string to be passed to UseProvider methods
  • Downgrade the ContextInitialized event from Information to Debug
  • Get an EntityEntry<TEntity> for Shared Entity Types
  • Make EntityEntryGraphIterator publicly usable
  • Support unidirectional many-to-many relationships
  • Translate string.Join and string.Concat
  • RevEng: Enable generating IEntityTypeConfiguration classes (avoids large OnModelCreating)
  • Interception to modify the LINQ expression tree
  • Interception for DbUpdateConcurrencyException
  • Add interception event to be fired when EF has finished consuming a result set
  • Add events for DetectChanges/state change
  • ChangeTracker: New event for "entity about to get tracked"
  • Translate EnvelopeCombiner.CombineAsGeometry aggregate function
  • SQL Server: Translate statistics aggregate functions
  • Filtered Includes for hidden navigation properties
  • Make it easier to pass a CancellationToken to FindAsync
  • Interception for object materialization (a.k.a. "ObjectMaterialized")
  • Provide a hook for identity resolution
  • Create lazy-loading and change-tracking proxy types lazily
  • Compiled model: Allow use of lazy loading and change tracking proxy types
  • Full support for custom provider aggregate functions
  • Spatial: Translate aggregate functions

... (truncated)

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

issue.title: GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint not working as expected and not retrieving profile claims
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende IdentityServer are you using?**
6.2.0
**Which version of .NET are you using?**
net7.0
**Describe the bug**
I'm following step by step quickstart.

I have the identity server configured with in memory identity resources for `OpenId` and `Profile`

profile claims not being produced despite adding
```
options.GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint = true; 
```
on oidc client, and asking for `openid` and `profile` scopes which are allowed at identity server's client configuration along with `AlwaysIncludeUserClaimsInIdToken`
```
{
    "Enabled": true,
    "ClientId": "client-web-sample",
    "ClientName": "Client Web Sample",
    "ClientSecrets": [
        {
            "Value": "whatever_encoded_secret"
        }
    ],
    "AllowedGrantTypes": [ "authorization_code" ],
    "RedirectUris": [ "http://localhost:6002/signin-oidc" ],
    "PostLogoutRedirectUris": [ "http://localhost:6002/signout-callback-oidc" ],
    "AllowedScopes": [ "openid", "profile", "my-api"],
    "AlwaysIncludeUserClaimsInIdToken": true
}
```

**To Reproduce**
[Following the documentation](https://docs.duendesoftware.com/identityserver/v6/quickstarts/2_interactive/#getting-claims-from-the-userinfo-endpoint)
I add 
```
options.GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint = true;
```
at the oidc client, which looks like this
```
JwtSecurityTokenHandler.DefaultMapInboundClaims = false;

builder
    .Services
    .AddAuthentication(options =>
    {
        options.DefaultScheme = "Cookies";
        options.DefaultChallengeScheme = "oidc";
    })
    .AddCookie("Cookies")
    .AddOpenIdConnect("oidc", options =>
    {
        options.Authority = "http://localhost:5000";
        options.RequireHttpsMetadata = false;

        options.ClientId = "client-web-sample";
        options.ClientSecret = "secret";
        options.ResponseType = "code";

        options.Scope.Clear();
        options.Scope.Add("openid");
        options.Scope.Add("profile");
        options.GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint = true; // isn't this to retrieve additional profile claims?

        options.SaveTokens = true;
    });
```

**Expected behavior**
I would expect, as documentation shows, to retrieve bob or alice's profile claims such as family_name, website, etc.
But no trace of these claims

```
Claims

amr
    pwd
sid
    42C3D4214BCE361508A736AA36D52932
sub
    2
auth_time
    1670419617
idp
    local
name
    bob

Properties

.AuthScheme
    oidc
.Token.access_token
    eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6IkJBREMwQzlBNEM3QkFFQzVBMUJFODBCM0QzQ0UzQzVBIiwidHlwIjoiYXQrand0In0..a--8mlsEYN9TGO5MsmQSSdAYem-cX8VoEsvkghcDPU-_nqv7NgzBPbXZL3lW9061gKmFE8G-pqhE05wMFlu-4Ny8srulgxih_YpngGzKaVgt_xlA7x0KRHs68HFPdPGcq4XRYpe8ebQmQblO8EC2lphN0C3L73Cm7eWd2NPLGLVw8Tz2O0SC4068GJvUM3FBbCu0sRWRRQYtgwLKrSaD29_jMSo_jr0Hi00twR95pEfulTtgYJ1-JIz8dakxGONcp_GW3iBtNQ2-v_GvPA2sMMxdeWy85lFY63KSXk5zok-C0ToFTpT19aSxWuRw1mJkUh3KB5szyNfRIxCoK-RDjA
.sessionState
    b-X9CyjgnpbB5XxrBbJQDedBIXXiczF8h6cYN5QpgP4.BA622A947E7C516F483167024BBD5A97
OpenIdConnect.Code.RedirectUri
    http://localhost:6002/signin-oidc
.checkSessionIFrame
    http://localhost:5000/connect/checksession
.Token.id_token
    eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6IkJBREMwQzlBNEM3QkFFQzVBMUJFODBCM0QzQ0UzQzVBIiwidHlwIjoiSldUIn0..gGznhznDBFXQzEfCMcUukOvwtBrhrtOBkCiWrpPt9FSavX3IAmgqWhxnGY7Jw9oBDqWwSb7ae3UwH97eo2GDtWitcsvle1-2jVu_gZkyJ_wol5WonopenolD-fv2pTOfQ12GkeFkUBEi6umPIyannZN_-tlsyZxDrU3KyhyuQzzVDG9Z8JOoKaOPHyOr8ai-klyrE6Wf20Bk7kTVMdjpKsqj_PctsPrc4QDuQgy3Xt341IJZeha0BNhQX3mk8OVgr1tu1250b2XlXOleDaLYNcgqdvZ8ij6pz-PyVt_jxtBnmO-cppb-2xtdR49FxZfedKYpCpUAWCGwzJrlq85kFw
.Token.token_type
    Bearer
.Token.expires_at
    2022-12-07T14:26:57.0000000+00:00
.TokenNames
    access_token;id_token;token_type;expires_at
.issued
    Wed, 07 Dec 2022 13:26:57 GMT
.expires
    Wed, 21 Dec 2022 13:26:57 GMT
```

**Log output/exception with stacktrace**

```
data
```

**Additional context**

Is the documentation incomplete? It'd be good to be able to read further on what could be the cause, as this is a bit confusing.

issue.title: Using CryptoHelper as general-purpose helper for non-OIDC OAuth2 clients
issue.body:
I would like to implement some OAuth2 flows with PKCE where the server does not have OIDC available (Spotify and Philips Hue).

The [`CryptoHelper` class](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient/blob/e786a8715fbc853c0dfa88ded2404f1b1ebc1190/src/OidcClient/CryptoHelper.cs#L17) would be really helpful there, but it prevents people from using it outside the OidcClient - even though I think it should not have dependencies.

It is marked `internal` and has a dependency on `OidcClientOptions` but it seems that those `OidcClientOptions` do not really have a function in the class.

Would it make sense to make this class `public` and move it to the generic [`IdentityModel`](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel) package? Or is there a better way to implement the OAuth2 flows for Spotify/Philips Hue?

Using OidcClient in general seems to have a dependency on the server implementing the `.well-known/openid-configuration` endpoint etc, which these APIs do not have.

comment.body: IdentityModel tries to have minimal dependencies and provides the primitives to build higher level libraries.

issue.title: `Invalid access token hash` error when validating at_hash with *384 and *512 signing algorithms
issue.body:
I get an `Invalid access token hash`. when trying to verify an identity token containing the `at_hash` claim and one of the following signature algorithms is used: RS384, RS512 ...

I tend to think that the `CryptoHelper.ValidateHash` method calculates an incorrect hash value for algorithm if the algorithm key length is not 256.
And the reason is in these two lines:

https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient/blob/acf47d22e4a8cd8b1ceeb4ae4dabec9e3b491cfb/src/OidcClient/CryptoHelper.cs#L61-L62

The size variable already contains the length of the needed part of the calculated hash, there is no need in the additional calculations in this lines.

comment.body:
Thanks for reporting.

Feel free to propose a fix PR - ideally with tests that exercise the various sizes.

issue.title: Add Prometheus IHttpClientFactory metrics to RemoteApis with simple HTTP forwarder
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende BFF are you using?**

2.0.0-preview.5

**Which version of .NET are you using?**

.NET Core 6.0

**Describe the question**

We use the [prometheus-net](https://github.com/prometheus-net/prometheus-net) project to instrument applications using Duende BFF. The Prometheus project includes a convenient extension method [UseHttpMetrics](https://github.com/prometheus-net/prometheus-net#ihttpclientfactory-metrics) on IHttpClientBuilder to instrument service-to-service calls. We are investigating ways to get similar behavior from Remote APIs using the built-in simple HTTP forwarder.

The Prometheus extension uses IHttpClientBuilder's ability to create a pipeline of HttpMessageHandler. Much of the implementation of both the ASP.NET Core and Prometheus extension is sealed or internal, so we can't reuse their code directly. We are considering writing our own pipeline of HttpMessageHandler and then subclassing DefaultHttpMessageInvokerFactory to return the pipeline in CreateHandler.

Are you aware of an easier solution than the one proposed above? Since Duende.Bff.Yarp uses HttpMessageInvoker instead of HttpClient, we are assuming the answer is no.

Do you have any concerns with this approach from either a correctness standpoint or compatibility with future versions of Duende.Bff and Duende.Bff.Yarp?

issue.title: scope claims not updated on refresh token request with requested scopes
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende IdentityServer are you using?**
6.2.0

**Which version of .NET are you using?**
7.0

**Describe the bug**
My client configuration is:
```cs
new Client
{
    ClientId = "mauiblazorsample",
    RequirePkce = true,
    RequireClientSecret = false,

    AllowedGrantTypes = GrantTypes.Code,

    RedirectUris = { "mauiblazorsample://authentication/login-callback" },
    PostLogoutRedirectUris = { "mauiblazorsample://authentication/logout-callback" },

    AllowOfflineAccess = true,
    AllowedScopes = { "openid", "profile", "scope1" },
                
    UpdateAccessTokenClaimsOnRefresh = true,
}
```
When I send a refresh token with the scope parameter, I expect the access_token to be updated with requested scopes but the access token returned contains scopes requested during authorization:

```http
POST /connect/token HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:5001
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

grant_type=refresh_token&refresh_token=3069641D41DAAD57AFE8EEAE21A55BAEF23F47A943516C62B83299A2E89BF868-1&scope=openid+scope1&client_id=test
```

```json
{
  "iss": "https://localhost:5001",
  "nbf": 1669843921,
  "iat": 1669843921,
  "exp": 1669847521,
  "scope": [
    "openid",
    "profile",
    "offline_access"
  ],
  "amr": [
    "pwd"
  ],
  "client_id": "mauiblazorsample",
  "sub": "1",
  "auth_time": 1669833311,
  "idp": "local",
  "sid": "345FF1C50B7BFCCECE7219BD6607EB38",
  "jti": "C9519A28873356A186B2A7903EB48FEC"
}
```

**Expected behavior**

The access token should contain scopes requested in the token request. For the example above, something like:

```json
{
  "iss": "https://localhost:5001",
  "nbf": 1669843921,
  "iat": 1669843921,
  "exp": 1669847521,
  "scope": [
    "openid",
    "scope1"
  ],
  "amr": [
    "pwd"
  ],
  "client_id": "mauiblazorsample",
  "sub": "1",
  "auth_time": 1669833311,
  "idp": "local",
  "sid": "345FF1C50B7BFCCECE7219BD6607EB38",
  "jti": "C9519A28873356A186B2A7903EB48FEC"
}

```

comment.body:
> When I send a refresh token with the scope parameter, I expect the access_token to be updated with requested scopes

This is not how it works. A refresh token can at maximum contain the scopes that were requested during the authorize request. Otherwise a client could potentially "silently" request scopes that were never consented to by the user.

The spec allows for "downscoping" - meaning a client could ask for less scopes during refresh. But we haven't implemented that.

By default a refresh token is an exact copy of the original token with an updates lifetime. `UpdateAccessTokenClaimsOnRefresh` means that we run through profile service again to update claims if needed.

issue.title: Request: add ConfigureAwaits in the Duende.AccessTokenManagement package
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende IdentityServer are you using?**
Duende.AccessTokenManagement.OpenIdConnect Version 1.0.0

**Which version of .NET are you using?**
net6.0

**Describe the bug**

Our team is using the Duende AccessTokenManagement OpenIdConnect package in our Blazor application to automatically get and refresh access tokens, using the GetAccessTokenAsync method. However, with the current version, the application hangs when trying to refresh the access tokens, in the UserTokenEndpointService.RefreshAccessTokenAsync method, where oidc.HttpClient.RequestRefreshTokenAsync is called. 

To fix the issue, we copied the implementations of IUserTokenManagementService, IUserTokenEndpointService and IUserTokenRequestSynchronization, and added ConfigureAwait(false) on every awaited Task. 

Is it possible for you to add a configurable ConfigureAwait on all awaited tasks? Similar to [this extension method from IdentityModel](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel/blob/main/src/Internal/TaskHelpers.cs)

comment.body:
To my knowledge, ASP.NET Core does not have a synchronization context. Thus ConfigureAwait is not necessary.

Do you have any documentation that states otherwise?

issue.title: Is IUserAccessTokenStore no longer injectable?
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende BFF are you using?**
v2.0.0

**Which version of .NET are you using?**
.NET 6

**Describe the bug**
Since the update to v2.0.0 of the package, It seems to be impossible to inject ```IUserAccessTokenStore``` to access the user token, it seems that starting v2.0.0 the ```.AddBff()``` extension method no longer registers the store. Are we expected to switch to injecting ```IClientCredentialsTokenManagementService``` instead? We would rather avoid it seeing how it introduces a dependency on ```Duende.Bff```

**Additional context**

Access to user token is required to setup a token delegation chain when calling remote APIs

comment.body:
Duende BFF switched to Duende.AccessTokenManagement for token management

https://github.com/DuendeSoftware/Duende.AccessTokenManagement

The class is now called `IUserTokenStore`.

issue.title: Using CryptoHelper as general-purpose helper for non-OIDC OAuth2 clients
issue.body:
I would like to implement some OAuth2 flows with PKCE where the server does not have OIDC available (Spotify and Philips Hue).

The [`CryptoHelper` class](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient/blob/e786a8715fbc853c0dfa88ded2404f1b1ebc1190/src/OidcClient/CryptoHelper.cs#L17) would be really helpful there, but it prevents people from using it outside the OidcClient - even though I think it should not have dependencies.

It is marked `internal` and has a dependency on `OidcClientOptions` but it seems that those `OidcClientOptions` do not really have a function in the class.

Would it make sense to make this class `public` and move it to the generic [`IdentityModel`](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel) package? Or is there a better way to implement the OAuth2 flows for Spotify/Philips Hue?

Using OidcClient in general seems to have a dependency on the server implementing the `.well-known/openid-configuration` endpoint etc, which these APIs do not have.

comment.body:
We currently have no plans to move this to IdentityModel. 

As I said before - feel free to copy the code for your own purposes.

issue.title: Using CryptoHelper as general-purpose helper for non-OIDC OAuth2 clients
issue.body:
I would like to implement some OAuth2 flows with PKCE where the server does not have OIDC available (Spotify and Philips Hue).

The [`CryptoHelper` class](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient/blob/e786a8715fbc853c0dfa88ded2404f1b1ebc1190/src/OidcClient/CryptoHelper.cs#L17) would be really helpful there, but it prevents people from using it outside the OidcClient - even though I think it should not have dependencies.

It is marked `internal` and has a dependency on `OidcClientOptions` but it seems that those `OidcClientOptions` do not really have a function in the class.

Would it make sense to make this class `public` and move it to the generic [`IdentityModel`](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel) package? Or is there a better way to implement the OAuth2 flows for Spotify/Philips Hue?

Using OidcClient in general seems to have a dependency on the server implementing the `.well-known/openid-configuration` endpoint etc, which these APIs do not have.

comment.body:
The "OIDC" stands for OpenID Connect. That's the focus of this library. We have not planned anything beyond that.

Feel free to fork the repo if you want to create derived work.

issue.title: EntityFramework.Storage project update AutoMapper to version 12 so that it works with .NET 7.
issue.body:
Hello,
I'm getting issues with IS4 running on .NET 7 It is easily resolved by updating AutoMapper to version 12 in the EntityFramework.Storage project. Can this be done please?
The error is: 
GenericArguments[0], 'System.Char', on 'T MaxFloat[T](System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1[T])' violates the constraint of type 'T'.

AutoMapper team fixed this in version 12:
https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/issues/3988

Thanks

comment.body:
> but what happens if you change the rules in the middle of the game, again!

You are raising a very good point here. With a real company and a real license/contract you can negotiate things like this just like with any other vendor you have. And we are happy to give you reasonable guarantees.

If you depend on someone's hobby project, you will not get any guarantees whatsoever.

pull_request.title: Introduce filter to allow suppression of unhandled exception logs in IdentityServer middleware
pull_request.body:
Allows customers to decide if our catch block around any IdentityServer endpoints will emit a log entry when there is an unhandled exception. The default, and primary use case is to suppress logs when the HTTP connection is cancelled early (e.g. a user navigates away or cancelled the browser request) and EF internally is detecting this and throwing the TaskCancelledException.

Fixes: https://github.com/DuendeSoftware/IdentityServer/issues/1040

pull_request.title: Bump OpenTelemetry.Extensions.Hosting from 1.0.0-rc9 to 1.0.0-rc9.9
pull_request.body:
Bumps [OpenTelemetry.Extensions.Hosting](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-dotnet) from 1.0.0-rc9 to 1.0.0-rc9.9.
Release notes

Sourced from OpenTelemetry.Extensions.Hosting's releases.

1.0.0-rc9.6

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.AspNetCore

  • Removed netstandard2.0 and netstandard2.1 targets. .NET 5 reached EOL in May 2022 and .NET Core 3.1 reaches EOL in December 2022. The instrumentation for ASP.NET Core now requires .NET 6 or later. (#3567)

  • Fixed an issue where activity started within middleware was modified by instrumentation library. (#3498)

  • Updated to use Activity native support from System.Diagnostics.DiagnosticSource to set activity status. (#3118) (#3555)

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.GrpcNetClient

  • Updated to use Activity native support from System.Diagnostics.DiagnosticSource to set activity status. (#3118) (#3569)

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http

  • Updated to use Activity native support from System.Diagnostics.DiagnosticSource to set activity status. (#3118) (#3555)

  • Changed activity source name from OpenTelemetry.HttpWebRequest to OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http.HttpWebRequest for HttpWebRequests and from OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http to OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http.HttpClient for HttpClient. (#3515)

1.0.0-rc9.5

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.AspNetCore

  • Fix Remote IP Address - NULL reference exception. (#3481)
  • Metrics instrumentation to correctly populate http.flavor tag. (1.1 instead of HTTP/1.1 etc.) (#3379)
  • Tracing instrumentation to populate http.flavor tag. (#3372)
  • Tracing instrumentation to populate http.scheme tag. (#3392)

  • be78372 Minor perf tweaks in Metrics (#3867)
  • 91607e7 More performance improvement when views are used (#3864)
  • 91a9b7c Minor perf improvement for metric (#3862)
  • 6c3beef [Repo] Expand processor & exporter section in tracing docs (#3855)
  • 399fbcf [Http Instrumentation] Unify exposed public API (#3793)

pull_request.title: Bump EntityFrameworkVersion from 6.0.0 to 7.0.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps `EntityFrameworkVersion` from 6.0.0 to 7.0.0. Updates `Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite` from 6.0.0 to 7.0.0
Release notes

Sourced from Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite's releases.

EF Core 7.0 (EF7) RC2 is available from NuGet

RC2 is does not include some important fixes that will be in the GA release. Therefore, we recommend using the daily builds when testing your applications with EF7.

RC2 contains the following new features:

  • Make basic EF scenarios work under aggressive trimming
  • Entity splitting support
  • Support for GroupBy entityType
  • Support GroupJoin when it is final query operator
  • ExecuteUpdate: Add SetProperty overload that accepts a value directly (no lambda)
  • Support sproc input/output parameters on non-concurrency-token properties
  • Implement TagWith for ExecuteUpdate and DeleteUpdate
  • ExecuteDelete for owner when only its owned types are sharing the same table
  • Stop scaffolding DbSet initialization to null!
  • CSharpHelper: support more types of collection literals

RC2 also includes the following new features from previews 1 through 7 and RC1:

  • Map JSON values stored in database to EF properties
  • ExecuteUpdate/Delete (AKA bulk update, without loading data into memory)
  • Code templates for scaffolding entity types and DbContext from an existing database
  • Support raw SQL Queries for basic types like Guid, DateTime and int
  • Allow applications to create model building conventions (aka public conventions)
  • Cosmos: Support AAD RBAC via the ClientSecretCredential
  • Map inserts, updates, and deletes (CUD operations) to stored procedures
  • Add a static flag in EF that will be set when code is being executed for design-time discover
  • Support sequence key generation on SQL Server, which is useful for Table-per-concrete-type (TPC) mapping
  • Allow null connection string to be passed to UseProvider methods
  • Downgrade the ContextInitialized event from Information to Debug
  • Get an EntityEntry<TEntity> for Shared Entity Types
  • Make EntityEntryGraphIterator publicly usable
  • Support unidirectional many-to-many relationships
  • Translate string.Join and string.Concat
  • RevEng: Enable generating IEntityTypeConfiguration classes (avoids large OnModelCreating)
  • Interception to modify the LINQ expression tree
  • Interception for DbUpdateConcurrencyException
  • Add interception event to be fired when EF has finished consuming a result set
  • Add events for DetectChanges/state change
  • ChangeTracker: New event for "entity about to get tracked"
  • Translate EnvelopeCombiner.CombineAsGeometry aggregate function
  • SQL Server: Translate statistics aggregate functions
  • Filtered Includes for hidden navigation properties
  • Make it easier to pass a CancellationToken to FindAsync
  • Interception for object materialization (a.k.a. "ObjectMaterialized")
  • Provide a hook for identity resolution
  • Create lazy-loading and change-tracking proxy types lazily
  • Compiled model: Allow use of lazy loading and change tracking proxy types
  • Full support for custom provider aggregate functions
  • Spatial: Translate aggregate functions

... (truncated)

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

Updates `Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer` from 6.0.0 to 7.0.0
Release notes

Sourced from Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer's releases.

EF Core 7.0 (EF7) RC2 is available from NuGet

RC2 is does not include some important fixes that will be in the GA release. Therefore, we recommend using the daily builds when testing your applications with EF7.

RC2 contains the following new features:

  • Make basic EF scenarios work under aggressive trimming
  • Entity splitting support
  • Support for GroupBy entityType
  • Support GroupJoin when it is final query operator
  • ExecuteUpdate: Add SetProperty overload that accepts a value directly (no lambda)
  • Support sproc input/output parameters on non-concurrency-token properties
  • Implement TagWith for ExecuteUpdate and DeleteUpdate
  • ExecuteDelete for owner when only its owned types are sharing the same table
  • Stop scaffolding DbSet initialization to null!
  • CSharpHelper: support more types of collection literals

RC2 also includes the following new features from previews 1 through 7 and RC1:

  • Map JSON values stored in database to EF properties
  • ExecuteUpdate/Delete (AKA bulk update, without loading data into memory)
  • Code templates for scaffolding entity types and DbContext from an existing database
  • Support raw SQL Queries for basic types like Guid, DateTime and int
  • Allow applications to create model building conventions (aka public conventions)
  • Cosmos: Support AAD RBAC via the ClientSecretCredential
  • Map inserts, updates, and deletes (CUD operations) to stored procedures
  • Add a static flag in EF that will be set when code is being executed for design-time discover
  • Support sequence key generation on SQL Server, which is useful for Table-per-concrete-type (TPC) mapping

  • Downgrade the ContextInitialized event from Information to Debug
  • Get an EntityEntry<TEntity> for Shared Entity Types
  • Make EntityEntryGraphIterator publicly usable

issue.title: GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint not working as expected and not retrieving profile claims
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende IdentityServer are you using?**
6.2.0
**Which version of .NET are you using?**
net7.0
**Describe the bug**
I'm following step by step quickstart.

I have the identity server configured with in memory identity resources for `OpenId` and `Profile`

profile claims not being produced despite adding
```
options.GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint = true; 
```
on oidc client, and asking for `openid` and `profile` scopes which are allowed at identity server's client configuration along with `AlwaysIncludeUserClaimsInIdToken`
```
{
    "Enabled": true,
    "ClientId": "client-web-sample",
    "ClientName": "Client Web Sample",
    "ClientSecrets": [
        {
            "Value": "whatever_encoded_secret"
        }
    ],
    "AllowedGrantTypes": [ "authorization_code" ],
    "RedirectUris": [ "http://localhost:6002/signin-oidc" ],
    "PostLogoutRedirectUris": [ "http://localhost:6002/signout-callback-oidc" ],
    "AllowedScopes": [ "openid", "profile", "my-api"],
    "AlwaysIncludeUserClaimsInIdToken": true
}
```

**To Reproduce**
[Following the documentation](https://docs.duendesoftware.com/identityserver/v6/quickstarts/2_interactive/#getting-claims-from-the-userinfo-endpoint)
I add 
```
options.GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint = true;
```
at the oidc client, which looks like this
```
JwtSecurityTokenHandler.DefaultMapInboundClaims = false;

builder
    .Services
    .AddAuthentication(options =>
    {
        options.DefaultScheme = "Cookies";
        options.DefaultChallengeScheme = "oidc";
    })
    .AddCookie("Cookies")
    .AddOpenIdConnect("oidc", options =>
    {
        options.Authority = "http://localhost:5000";
        options.RequireHttpsMetadata = false;

        options.ClientId = "client-web-sample";
        options.ClientSecret = "secret";
        options.ResponseType = "code";

        options.Scope.Clear();
        options.Scope.Add("openid");
        options.Scope.Add("profile");
        options.GetClaimsFromUserInfoEndpoint = true; // isn't this to retrieve additional profile claims?

        options.SaveTokens = true;
    });
```

**Expected behavior**
I would expect, as documentation shows, to retrieve bob or alice's profile claims such as family_name, website, etc.
But no trace of these claims

```

.sessionState

comment.body:
By default the Microsoft OIDC handler is only forwarding a subset of the claims to the application session.

You need to explicitly map them, see e.g. here:

https://github.com/DuendeSoftware/Samples/blob/main/IdentityServer/v6/Quickstarts/2_InteractiveAspNetCore/src/WebClient/Program.cs#L29

issue.title: Using CryptoHelper as general-purpose helper for non-OIDC OAuth2 clients
issue.body:
I would like to implement some OAuth2 flows with PKCE where the server does not have OIDC available (Spotify and Philips Hue).

The [`CryptoHelper` class](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient/blob/e786a8715fbc853c0dfa88ded2404f1b1ebc1190/src/OidcClient/CryptoHelper.cs#L17) would be really helpful there, but it prevents people from using it outside the OidcClient - even though I think it should not have dependencies.

It is marked `internal` and has a dependency on `OidcClientOptions` but it seems that those `OidcClientOptions` do not really have a function in the class.

Would it make sense to make this class `public` and move it to the generic [`IdentityModel`](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel) package? Or is there a better way to implement the OAuth2 flows for Spotify/Philips Hue?

Using OidcClient in general seems to have a dependency on the server implementing the `.well-known/openid-configuration` endpoint etc, which these APIs do not have.

comment.body: IdentityModel tries to have minimal dependencies and provides the primitives to build higher level libraries.

issue.title: `Invalid access token hash` error when validating at_hash with *384 and *512 signing algorithms
issue.body:
I get an `Invalid access token hash`. when trying to verify an identity token containing the `at_hash` claim and one of the following signature algorithms is used: RS384, RS512 ...

I tend to think that the `CryptoHelper.ValidateHash` method calculates an incorrect hash value for algorithm if the algorithm key length is not 256.
And the reason is in these two lines:

https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient/blob/acf47d22e4a8cd8b1ceeb4ae4dabec9e3b491cfb/src/OidcClient/CryptoHelper.cs#L61-L62

The size variable already contains the length of the needed part of the calculated hash, there is no need in the additional calculations in this lines.

comment.body:
Thanks for reporting.

Feel free to propose a fix PR - ideally with tests that exercise the various sizes.

issue.title: Add Prometheus IHttpClientFactory metrics to RemoteApis with simple HTTP forwarder
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende BFF are you using?**

2.0.0-preview.5

**Which version of .NET are you using?**

.NET Core 6.0

**Describe the question**

We use the [prometheus-net](https://github.com/prometheus-net/prometheus-net) project to instrument applications using Duende BFF. The Prometheus project includes a convenient extension method [UseHttpMetrics](https://github.com/prometheus-net/prometheus-net#ihttpclientfactory-metrics) on IHttpClientBuilder to instrument service-to-service calls. We are investigating ways to get similar behavior from Remote APIs using the built-in simple HTTP forwarder.

The Prometheus extension uses IHttpClientBuilder's ability to create a pipeline of HttpMessageHandler. Much of the implementation of both the ASP.NET Core and Prometheus extension is sealed or internal, so we can't reuse their code directly. We are considering writing our own pipeline of HttpMessageHandler and then subclassing DefaultHttpMessageInvokerFactory to return the pipeline in CreateHandler.

Are you aware of an easier solution than the one proposed above? Since Duende.Bff.Yarp uses HttpMessageInvoker instead of HttpClient, we are assuming the answer is no.

Do you have any concerns with this approach from either a correctness standpoint or compatibility with future versions of Duende.Bff and Duende.Bff.Yarp?

issue.title: scope claims not updated on refresh token request with requested scopes
issue.body:
**Which version of Duende IdentityServer are you using?**
6.2.0

**Which version of .NET are you using?**
7.0

**Describe the bug**
My client configuration is:
```cs
new Client
{
    ClientId = "mauiblazorsample",
    RequirePkce = true,
    RequireClientSecret = false,

    AllowedGrantTypes = GrantTypes.Code,

    RedirectUris = { "mauiblazorsample://authentication/login-callback" },
    PostLogoutRedirectUris = { "mauiblazorsample://authentication/logout-callback" },

    AllowOfflineAccess = true,
    AllowedScopes = { "openid", "profile", "scope1" },
                
    UpdateAccessTokenClaimsOnRefresh = true,
}
```
When I send a refresh token with the scope parameter, I expect the access_token to be updated with requested scopes but the access token returned contains scopes requested during authorization:

```http
POST /connect/token HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:5001
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

grant_type=refresh_token&refresh_token=3069641D41DAAD57AFE8EEAE21A55BAEF23F47A943516C62B83299A2E89BF868-1&scope=openid+scope1&client_id=test
```

```json
{
  "iss": "https://localhost:5001",
  "nbf": 1669843921,
  "iat": 1669843921,
  "exp": 1669847521,
  "scope": [
    "openid",
    "profile",
    "offline_access"
  ],
  "amr": [
    "pwd"
  ],
  "client_id": "mauiblazorsample",
  "sub": "1",
  "auth_time": 1669833311,
  "idp": "local",
  "sid": "345FF1C50B7BFCCECE7219BD6607EB38",
  "jti": "C9519A28873356A186B2A7903EB48FEC"
}
```

**Expected behavior**

The access token should contain scopes requested in the token request. For the example above, something like:

```json
{
  "iss": "https://localhost:5001",
  "nbf": 1669843921,
  "iat": 1669843921,
  "exp": 1669847521,
  "scope": [
    "openid",
    "scope1"
  ],
  "amr": [
    "pwd"
  ],
  "client_id": "mauiblazorsample",
  "sub": "1",
  "auth_time": 1669833311,
  "idp": "local",
  "sid": "345FF1C50B7BFCCECE7219BD6607EB38",
  "jti": "C9519A28873356A186B2A7903EB48FEC"
}

```

comment.body:
> When I send a refresh token with the scope parameter, I expect the access_token to be updated with requested scopes

This is not how it works. A refresh token can at maximum contain the scopes that were requested during the authorize request. Otherwise a client could potentially "silently" request scopes that were never consented to by the user.

The spec allows for "downscoping" - meaning a client could ask for less scopes during refresh. But we haven't implemented that.

By default a refresh token is an exact copy of the original token with an updates lifetime. `UpdateAccessTokenClaimsOnRefresh` means that we run through profile service again to update claims if needed.

issue.body:
**Which version of Duende IdentityServer are you using?**
Duende.AccessTokenManagement.OpenIdConnect Version 1.0.0

**Which version of .NET are you using?**
net6.0

**Describe the bug**

Our team is using the Duende AccessTokenManagement OpenIdConnect package in our Blazor application to automatically get and refresh access tokens, using the GetAccessTokenAsync method. However, with the current version, the application hangs when trying to refresh the access tokens, in the UserTokenEndpointService.RefreshAccessTokenAsync method, where oidc.HttpClient.RequestRefreshTokenAsync is called. 

To fix the issue, we copied the implementations of IUserTokenManagementService, IUserTokenEndpointService and IUserTokenRequestSynchronization, and added ConfigureAwait(false) on every awaited Task. 

Is it possible for you to add a configurable ConfigureAwait on all awaited tasks? Similar to [this extension method from IdentityModel](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel/blob/main/src/Internal/TaskHelpers.cs)

comment.body:
To my knowledge, ASP.NET Core does not have a synchronization context. Thus ConfigureAwait is not necessary.

Do you have any documentation that states otherwise?

This organization is not maintained anymore besides critical security bugfixes (if feasible). This organization will be archived when .NET Core 3.1 end of support is reached (3rd Dec 2022). All new development is happening in the new [Duende Software](https://github.com/duendesoftware) organization. 

IdentityServer4 is not compatible with .NET 7.

The new [Duende IdentityServer](https://duendesoftware.com/products/identityserver) comes with a commercial license but is [free](https://blog.duendesoftware.com/posts/20220111_fair_trade/) for dev/testing/personal projects and companies or individuals making less than 1M USD gross annnual revenue. Please [get in touch with us](https://duendesoftware.com/contact) if you have any question.

issue.title: Using CryptoHelper as general-purpose helper for non-OIDC OAuth2 clients
issue.body:
I would like to implement some OAuth2 flows with PKCE where the server does not have OIDC available (Spotify and Philips Hue).

The [`CryptoHelper` class](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient/blob/e786a8715fbc853c0dfa88ded2404f1b1ebc1190/src/OidcClient/CryptoHelper.cs#L17) would be really helpful there, but it prevents people from using it outside the OidcClient - even though I think it should not have dependencies.

It is marked `internal` and has a dependency on `OidcClientOptions` but it seems that those `OidcClientOptions` do not really have a function in the class.

Would it make sense to make this class `public` and move it to the generic [`IdentityModel`](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel) package? Or is there a better way to implement the OAuth2 flows for Spotify/Philips Hue?

Using OidcClient in general seems to have a dependency on the server implementing the `.well-known/openid-configuration` endpoint etc, which these APIs do not have.

comment.body:
We currently have no plans to move this to IdentityModel. 

As I said before - feel free to copy the code for your own purposes.

issue.body:
I would like to implement some OAuth2 flows with PKCE where the server does not have OIDC available (Spotify and Philips Hue).

The [`CryptoHelper` class](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel.OidcClient/blob/e786a8715fbc853c0dfa88ded2404f1b1ebc1190/src/OidcClient/CryptoHelper.cs#L17) would be really helpful there, but it prevents people from using it outside the OidcClient - even though I think it should not have dependencies.

It is marked `internal` and has a dependency on `OidcClientOptions` but it seems that those `OidcClientOptions` do not really have a function in the class.

Would it make sense to make this class `public` and move it to the generic [`IdentityModel`](https://github.com/IdentityModel/IdentityModel) package? Or is there a better way to implement the OAuth2 flows for Spotify/Philips Hue?

Using OidcClient in general seems to have a dependency on the server implementing the `.well-known/openid-configuration` endpoint etc, which these APIs do not have.

comment.body:
The "OIDC" stands for OpenID Connect. That's the focus of this library. We have not planned anything beyond that.

Feel free to fork the repo if you want to create derived work.

issue.title: EntityFramework.Storage project update AutoMapper to version 12 so that it works with .NET 7.
issue.body:
Hello,
I'm getting issues with IS4 running on .NET 7 It is easily resolved by updating AutoMapper to version 12 in the EntityFramework.Storage project. Can this be done please?
The error is: 
GenericArguments[0], 'System.Char', on 'T MaxFloat[T](System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1[T])' violates the constraint of type 'T'.

AutoMapper team fixed this in version 12:
https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/issues/3988

Thanks

comment.body:
> but what happens if you change the rules in the middle of the game, again!

You are raising a very good point here. With a real company and a real license/contract you can negotiate things like this just like with any other vendor you have. And we are happy to give you reasonable guarantees.

If you depend on someone's hobby project, you will not get any guarantees whatsoever.

pull_request.title: Introduce filter to allow suppression of unhandled exception logs in IdentityServer middleware
pull_request.body:
Allows customers to decide if our catch block around any IdentityServer endpoints will emit a log entry when there is an unhandled exception. The default, and primary use case is to suppress logs when the HTTP connection is cancelled early (e.g. a user navigates away or cancelled the browser request) and EF internally is detecting this and throwing the TaskCancelledException.

Fixes: https://github.com/DuendeSoftware/IdentityServer/issues/1040

Release notes

Sourced from OpenTelemetry.Extensions.Hosting's releases.

1.0.0-rc9.6

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.AspNetCore

  • Removed netstandard2.0 and netstandard2.1 targets. .NET 5 reached EOL in May 2022 and .NET Core 3.1 reaches EOL in December 2022. The instrumentation for ASP.NET Core now requires .NET 6 or later. (#3567)

  • Fixed an issue where activity started within middleware was modified by instrumentation library. (#3498)

  • Updated to use Activity native support from System.Diagnostics.DiagnosticSource to set activity status. (#3118) (#3555)

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.GrpcNetClient

  • Updated to use Activity native support from System.Diagnostics.DiagnosticSource to set activity status. (#3118) (#3569)

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http

  • Updated to use Activity native support from System.Diagnostics.DiagnosticSource to set activity status. (#3118) (#3555)

  • Changed activity source name from OpenTelemetry.HttpWebRequest to OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http.HttpWebRequest for HttpWebRequests and from OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http to OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http.HttpClient for HttpClient. (#3515)

1.0.0-rc9.5

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.AspNetCore

  • Fix Remote IP Address - NULL reference exception. (#3481)
  • Metrics instrumentation to correctly populate http.flavor tag. (1.1 instead of HTTP/1.1 etc.) (#3379)

pull_request.body:
Bumps [OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.SqlClient](https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-dotnet) from 1.0.0-rc9 to 1.0.0-rc9.9.
Release notes

Sourced from OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.SqlClient's releases.

1.0.0-rc9.6

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.AspNetCore

  • Removed netstandard2.0 and netstandard2.1 targets. .NET 5 reached EOL in May 2022 and .NET Core 3.1 reaches EOL in December 2022. The instrumentation for ASP.NET Core now requires .NET 6 or later. (#3567)

  • Fixed an issue where activity started within middleware was modified by instrumentation library. (#3498)

  • Updated to use Activity native support from System.Diagnostics.DiagnosticSource to set activity status. (#3118) (#3555)

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.GrpcNetClient

  • Updated to use Activity native support from System.Diagnostics.DiagnosticSource to set activity status. (#3118) (#3569)

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http

  • Updated to use Activity native support from System.Diagnostics.DiagnosticSource to set activity status. (#3118) (#3555)

  • Changed activity source name from OpenTelemetry.HttpWebRequest to OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http.HttpWebRequest for HttpWebRequests and from OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http to OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.Http.HttpClient for HttpClient. (#3515)

1.0.0-rc9.5

OpenTelemetry.Instrumentation.AspNetCore

  • Fix Remote IP Address - NULL reference exception. (#3481)
  • Metrics instrumentation to correctly populate http.flavor tag. (1.1 instead of HTTP/1.1 etc.) (#3379)
  • Tracing instrumentation to populate http.flavor tag. (#3372)
  • Tracing instrumentation to populate http.scheme tag. (#3392)

pull_request.title: Bump EntityFrameworkVersion from 6.0.0 to 7.0.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps `EntityFrameworkVersion` from 6.0.0 to 7.0.0. Updates `Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite` from 6.0.0 to 7.0.0
Release notes

Sourced from Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite's releases.

EF Core 7.0 (EF7) RC2 is available from NuGet

RC2 is does not include some important fixes that will be in the GA release. Therefore, we recommend using the daily builds when testing your applications with EF7.

RC2 contains the following new features:

  • Make basic EF scenarios work under aggressive trimming
  • Entity splitting support
  • Support for GroupBy entityType
  • Support GroupJoin when it is final query operator
  • ExecuteUpdate: Add SetProperty overload that accepts a value directly (no lambda)
  • Support sproc input/output parameters on non-concurrency-token properties
  • Implement TagWith for ExecuteUpdate and DeleteUpdate
  • ExecuteDelete for owner when only its owned types are sharing the same table
  • Stop scaffolding DbSet initialization to null!
  • CSharpHelper: support more types of collection literals

RC2 also includes the following new features from previews 1 through 7 and RC1:

  • Map JSON values stored in database to EF properties
  • ExecuteUpdate/Delete (AKA bulk update, without loading data into memory)
  • Code templates for scaffolding entity types and DbContext from an existing database
  • Support raw SQL Queries for basic types like Guid, DateTime and int
  • Allow applications to create model building conventions (aka public conventions)
  • Cosmos: Support AAD RBAC via the ClientSecretCredential
  • Map inserts, updates, and deletes (CUD operations) to stored procedures
  • Add a static flag in EF that will be set when code is being executed for design-time discover
  • Support sequence key generation on SQL Server, which is useful for Table-per-concrete-type (TPC) mapping
  • Allow null connection string to be passed to UseProvider methods
  • Downgrade the ContextInitialized event from Information to Debug
  • Get an EntityEntry<TEntity> for Shared Entity Types
  • Make EntityEntryGraphIterator publicly usable
  • Support unidirectional many-to-many relationships
  • Translate string.Join and string.Concat
  • RevEng: Enable generating IEntityTypeConfiguration classes (avoids large OnModelCreating)
  • Interception to modify the LINQ expression tree
  • Interception for DbUpdateConcurrencyException
  • Add interception event to be fired when EF has finished consuming a result set
  • Add events for DetectChanges/state change
  • ChangeTracker: New event for "entity about to get tracked"
  • Translate EnvelopeCombiner.CombineAsGeometry aggregate function
  • SQL Server: Translate statistics aggregate functions
  • Filtered Includes for hidden navigation properties
  • Make it easier to pass a CancellationToken to FindAsync
  • Interception for object materialization (a.k.a. "ObjectMaterialized")
  • Provide a hook for identity resolution
  • Create lazy-loading and change-tracking proxy types lazily
  • Compiled model: Allow use of lazy loading and change tracking proxy types
  • Full support for custom provider aggregate functions
  • Spatial: Translate aggregate functions

... (truncated)

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view
